alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 04 at 6:37PM MST until March 05 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Critical fire weather conditions expected across portions of the area on Sunday, mainly south of Interstate 70. Portions of the Fire Weather Watch have been upgraded to a Red Flag Warning ... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MST /NOON CST/ TO 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ SUNDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 027, 028, 041, 042, AND 254... * Affected Area...In Colorado, Fire Weather Zone 254 Cheyenne. In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 027 Wallace, Fire Weather Zone 028 Logan, Fire Weather Zone 041 Greeley and Fire Weather Zone 042 Wichita. * Winds...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 12 percent. * Temperatures...In the upper 60s. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or are imminent. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
